data.title: My Husband James â€“ Tiffany Dawn
data.meta_description: These posts feature my wonderful husband James, so you can get to know him a little more too. I'm so thankful for him!
data.text:
If youâ€™ve ever wondered if something was wrong with youâ€¦

â€¦or wondered if youâ€™ll ever fall in loveâ€¦

â€¦or if your heart cried over all the adventures youâ€™ll have to tell your husband about someday, instead of make with himâ€¦

Iâ€™ve been there.

Continue reading â†’

Iâ€™m sitting here at my favorite place on earth: a local coffee shop.

The glossy, wooden tables and deep red walls set nicely against the Alaskan mountains in the distance. Thatâ€™s right: Iâ€™m at a coffee shop in Anchorage, Alaska! (Can I just take a moment to do a happy dance?!) My husband James had some clients to see up here, and we decided to turn it into our one-year anniversary trip!

You see, this week is a big week. Yesterday was our first wedding anniversary. Thursday is my 30th birthday.

And this past weekend was my â€œ13 Going on 30â€ birthday party â€” celebrating both my inner teen and 30-year-old body.

The party was complete with hair & body glitter, a candy bar, Polaroids and a â€œyearbookâ€ to sign, and was held in a COFFEE SHOP. (I felt SO LOVED â€” thanks to my hubby and bestie for throwing this amazing party!!)

Below Iâ€™ve included a couple photos â€” I try not to put people up on my social media without their permission, so Iâ€™ve included one of me and two of my closest girlfriends (we tried painting our eyes bright teenage colors though you canâ€™t see it well here) as well as one of me and my hubby, James. ğŸ™‚

So here we are at age 30. Just twelve short months that seem to contain a lifetime have passed since we said â€œI do.â€ And every day, I am so thankful we did.

Continue reading â†’

This is the question that plagued me all through high school, college, and my early 20s: How will I know if someone is the one I want to spend my life with?

I thought it would be a gut feeling. I thought that somewhere deep inside, my heart would immediately know when I met â€œthe one.â€

And that did happen for me. Three different times. With three different guys. And sadly, none of them were my husband James!

Continue reading â†’

This was our first married Valentineâ€™s Dayâ€¦and it ended up hilariously different than we expected!

First, I have to give some back story.

Last year was our first Valentineâ€™s Day together. We stayed with my grandparents to celebrate in one of our favorite cities: Austin, TX. We frequented classy restaurants, explored the city in 70-degree weather, and filled our days with shooting lessons and tandem biking in adorable outfits.

It was the exact opposite of this year.

Actually, side note: Last year was the first Valentineâ€™s Day James had ever spent with a girl, and one of the few Iâ€™d ever spent with a guy. Most of his Valentineâ€™s Day were spent watching chick flicks with guy friends (for real), and mine were spent watching chick flicks with girl friends.

So of course, I was thinking: Our first married Valentineâ€™s Day is going to be SO romantic.

Continue reading â†’

Yesterday was my husbandâ€™s 28th birthday,

so he decided to celebrate the fact that this was the last time his age would be a mathematically â€œperfect numberâ€ â€¦ by celebrating each of the factors of 28 (the factors are: 14, 7, 4, 2, and 1). (He explains it more in the video below.) He decided this meant doing the following things:

Seeing 14 special people

Getting 7 free birthday foods

Doing 4 random acts of kindness

Doing 2 athletic activities

Watching 1 birthday movie

We did it ALL!! (And boy am I tired today.)

This celebration involved two things in particular that he LOVES: People and food.

Continue reading â†’

Iâ€™m such a creeper for capturing this, but couldnâ€™t resist. Walked out of the bedroom at 6:30 this morning to see my husband and three of his friends praying over their families, community, and world. ğŸ˜ğŸ’“ Girls, THIS is a man worth waiting for!! Not someone whoâ€™s perfect, but someone who loves Jesus and cares about others with everything heâ€™s got, even when no one is looking.

You basically canâ€™t get much more newlywed than us, so friends keep asking what our most shocking discovery of marriage has been thus far, and each time we say:

We canâ€™t sleep while cuddling!

At least not yet. Jamesâ€™s body is just SO WARM, itâ€™s like my own space heater! So at first Iâ€™m curled up next to him, shaking with cold, but then next thing you know Iâ€™m throwing off the covers from what feels like heat stroke!

(And James does not like when I throw off the covers. He likes his covers to be like â€œlasagna,â€ with every layer pulled up nice and high, and so he starts asking why Iâ€™m messing up his â€œlasagna.â€) (Only he would describe his cover arrangements as one of his favorite meals.)

Continue reading â†’

That question tormented me all through high schoolâ€¦and collegeâ€¦and my twenties.

â€œWhat if I miss him?â€

â€œWhat if I marry the wrong person?â€

â€œWhat if I never meet â€˜the oneâ€™?â€

And then it would all come back around to: â€œHow do I know if someone is â€˜the oneâ€™?â€

Iâ€™m not even going to pretend to know the answer to that question. I may be married, but that â€œknowingâ€ still feels very much a mystery.

However, I do want to share the things that made me feel incredibly confident that I wanted to marry James (my husband of 10 weeks. You canâ€™t get much more newlywed than us! ;-))

I never thought Iâ€™d feel confident about getting married; I was terrified of the prospect with the guys I previously dated! And yetâ€¦I walked down the aisle without fear. Full of excitement.

So this blog is about why I was quite sure that James was â€œmy one.â€

And how meeting â€œthe oneâ€ three times helped me find â€œmy one.â€
